abstracts.cdata!:
The project achieved most of its stated
            objectives and its overall outcome was rated satisfactory.
            The key lessons are: 1) Strong Government support and
            participation in the design and implementation of the public
            enterprise (PE) reform and privatization program was a sine
            qua non condition to the success of these reforms. 2)
            Parastatal Sector Reform Agency (CRSP) played a critical
            role in the design and implementation of reforms, including
            privatization and divestiture, and provided the necessary
            leadership to ensure ownership of the process. 3)
            Performance agreements (PAs) help clarify goals, increase
            autonomy, and open the dialogue between management and
            government - but their benefits have been oversold. In
            retrospect, the Bank should have put utility sector policy
            and regulatory reforms, privatization and private
            participation as key elements of the PE reform program,
            rather than restructuring under PAs.
